title: About
text:
Maliik Jones
University of Nebraska-Lincoln Student

title: How the College Basketball Preseason Rankings Turned Out
text:
The AP top 25 polls come in each week of the NCAA Basketball season. These are the compiled pollings from sportswriters and broadcasters all around the country. So, just how accurate are these rankings from the start of the season to the end.
I took a look at the stats from the top five basketball teams from the preseason and then compared them to the stats of the final top five teams. Obviously, I’m not going to look at each and every category so I summed up defense into steals, blocks, and rebounds. Then I summed up offense into field goal percentage, three point percentage, and assist to turnover ratio.
Personally, I believe that these are purely guesses and it’s not possible to KNOW who’s going to be a top caliber team. Maybe you can tell if a team will win most of their games, but winning at a high level? College basketball has way too many factors and underdogs to truly know.
Let’s peek at the preseason stats first:


Code
library(tidyverse)


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors


Code
library(gt)

bball <- read_csv("logs24.csv")


Rows: 11907 Columns: 48
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr   (8): Season, TeamFull, Opponent, HomeAway, W_L, URL, Conference, Team
dbl  (39): Game, TeamScore, OpponentScore, TeamFG, TeamFGA, TeamFGPCT, Team3...
date  (1): Date

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
pretop5def <- bball |>
  filter(TeamFull=="Duke Blue Devils" |
         TeamFull=="Kansas Jayhawks" |
         TeamFull=="Marquette Golden Eagles" |
         TeamFull=="Michigan State Spartans" |
         TeamFull=="Purdue Boilermakers") |>
  select(TeamFull, TeamSteals, TeamBlocks, TeamTotalRebounds) |>
  group_by(TeamFull) |>
  summarize(
    TotalSteals = sum(TeamSteals),
    TotalBlocks = sum(TeamBlocks),
    TotalRebounds = sum(TeamTotalRebounds))

pretop5def |> 
  gt() |> 
  cols_label(
    TeamFull = "Team",
    TotalSteals = "Total Team Steals",
    TotalBlocks = "Total Team Blocks",
    TotalRebounds = "Total Team Rebounds"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "How the preseason top 5 teams competed on defense.",
    subtitle = "Purdue was the only team to stay top 5 and they led in blocks & rebounds."
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Maliik Jones  |  **Source:** College Basketball at Sports-Reference.com: AP Polls")
  )|>
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "green"),
      cell_text(color = "black")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = TeamFull == "Purdue Boilermakers")
  )








How the preseason top 5 teams competed on defense.


Purdue was the only team to stay top 5 and they led in blocks & rebounds.


Team
Total Team Steals
Total Team Blocks
Total Team Rebounds




Duke Blue Devils
227
127
1145


Kansas Jayhawks
243
133
1116


Marquette Golden Eagles
310
125
1087


Michigan State Spartans
248
132
1112


Purdue Boilermakers
196
135
1335



By: Maliik Jones | Source: College Basketball at Sports-Reference.com: AP Polls








Here you can see that Purdue is a standout team compared to the other four. Purdue was also the only team to stay in the top five at the end of the season.
Now, let’s look at the offense:


Code
pretop5off <- bball |>
  filter(TeamFull=="Duke Blue Devils" |
         TeamFull=="Kansas Jayhawks" |
         TeamFull=="Marquette Golden Eagles" |
         TeamFull=="Michigan State Spartans" |
         TeamFull=="Purdue Boilermakers") |>
  select(TeamFull, TeamFG, TeamFGA, Team3P, Team3PA, TeamAssists, TeamTurnovers) |>
  group_by(TeamFull) |>
  summarize(
    TotalFG = sum(TeamFG),
    TotalFGA = sum(TeamFGA),
    Total3P = sum(Team3P),
    Total3PA = sum(Team3PA),
    TotalAst = sum(TeamAssists),
    TotalTurnovers = sum(TeamTurnovers))|>
  mutate(FGPct = TotalFG/TotalFGA, ThreePct = Total3P/Total3PA, AstTO = TotalAst/TotalTurnovers) |>
  select(TeamFull, FGPct, ThreePct, AstTO)

pretop5off |> 
  gt() |> 
  cols_label(
    TeamFull = "Team",
    FGPct = "Total Field Goal Percentage",
    ThreePct = "Total Three Point Percentage",
    AstTO = "Assist/Turnover Ratio"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "How the preseason top 5 teams performed offensively throughout the season.",
    subtitle = "Purdue was the only team to stay top 5 and they led in all categories."
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Maliik Jones  |  **Source:** College Basketball at Sports-Reference.com: AP Polls")
  )|>
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "green"),
      cell_text(color = "black")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = TeamFull == "Purdue Boilermakers")
  )








How the preseason top 5 teams performed offensively throughout the season.


Purdue was the only team to stay top 5 and they led in all categories.


Team
Total Field Goal Percentage
Total Three Point Percentage
Assist/Turnover Ratio




Duke Blue Devils
0.4815369
0.3806366
1.669841


Kansas Jayhawks
0.4880529
0.3321976
1.671835


Marquette Golden Eagles
0.4817851
0.3600892
1.644886


Michigan State Spartans
0.4611273
0.3626198
1.685801


Purdue Boilermakers
0.4902629
0.4091540
1.729659



By: Maliik Jones | Source: College Basketball at Sports-Reference.com: AP Polls








As you can see from the offensive side Purdue still stands out compared to the other four teams.
Now, let’s take a look at the teams who ended up in the top five after the season was over:


Code
posttop5def <- bball |>
  filter(TeamFull=="Alabama Crimson Tide" |
         TeamFull=="Houston Cougars" |
         TeamFull=="UConn Huskies" |
         TeamFull=="Purdue Boilermakers" |
         TeamFull=="Tennessee Volunteers") |>
  select(TeamFull, TeamSteals, TeamBlocks, TeamTotalRebounds) |>
  group_by(TeamFull) |>
  summarize(
    TotalSteals = sum(TeamSteals),
    TotalBlocks = sum(TeamBlocks),
    TotalRebounds = sum(TeamTotalRebounds))

posttop5def |> 
  gt() |> 
  cols_label(
    TeamFull = "Team",
    TotalSteals = "Total Team Steals",
    TotalBlocks = "Total Team Blocks",
    TotalRebounds = "Total Team Rebounds"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "How the post-season top 5 teams competed on defense.",
    subtitle = "All five of these teams ended up performing at a higher level than the predicted top 5 teams."
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Maliik Jones  |  **Source:** College Basketball at Sports-Reference.com: AP Polls")
  )








How the post-season top 5 teams competed on defense.


All five of these teams ended up performing at a higher level than the predicted top 5 teams.


Team
Total Team Steals
Total Team Blocks
Total Team Rebounds




Alabama Crimson Tide
247
144
1229


Houston Cougars
358
174
1243


Purdue Boilermakers
196
135
1335


Tennessee Volunteers
267
157
1234


UConn Huskies
224
194
1273



By: Maliik Jones | Source: College Basketball at Sports-Reference.com: AP Polls








Defensively, these five teams all did statistically better than the predicted top five teams in preseason.
Now, let’s look at the offense:


Code
posttop5off <- bball |>
  filter(TeamFull=="Alabama Crimson Tide" |
         TeamFull=="Houston Cougars" |
         TeamFull=="Purdue Boilermakers" |
         TeamFull=="Tennessee Volunteers" |
         TeamFull=="UConn Huskies") |>
  select(TeamFull, TeamFG, TeamFGA, Team3P, Team3PA, TeamAssists, TeamTurnovers) |>
  group_by(TeamFull) |>
  summarize(
    TotalFG = sum(TeamFG),
    TotalFGA = sum(TeamFGA),
    Total3P = sum(Team3P),
    Total3PA = sum(Team3PA),
    TotalAst = sum(TeamAssists),
    TotalTurnovers = sum(TeamTurnovers))|>
  mutate(FGPct = TotalFG/TotalFGA, ThreePct = Total3P/Total3PA, AstTO = TotalAst/TotalTurnovers) |>
  select(TeamFull, FGPct, ThreePct, AstTO)

posttop5off |> 
  gt() |> 
  cols_label(
    TeamFull = "Team",
    FGPct = "Total Field Goal Percentage",
    ThreePct = "Total Three Point Percentage",
    AstTO = "Assist/Turnover Ratio"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "How the post-season top 5 teams performed offensively throughout the season.",
    subtitle = "Their offensive stats were pretty similar compared to the preseason top 5 teams."
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Maliik Jones  |  **Source:** College Basketball at Sports-Reference.com: AP Polls")
  )








How the post-season top 5 teams performed offensively throughout the season.


Their offensive stats were pretty similar compared to the preseason top 5 teams.


Team
Total Field Goal Percentage
Total Three Point Percentage
Assist/Turnover Ratio




Alabama Crimson Tide
0.4772520
0.3665689
1.362500


Houston Cougars
0.4400183
0.3493235
1.569536


Purdue Boilermakers
0.4902629
0.4091540
1.729659


Tennessee Volunteers
0.4426934
0.3387283
1.638728


UConn Huskies
0.4981114
0.3612079
2.074074



By: Maliik Jones | Source: College Basketball at Sports-Reference.com: AP Polls








While, offensively these teams were pretty similar in stats to the top five teams in the preseason. So, is defense the big factor to become a real top five caliber squad? I guess defense really does win games.
I also found it interesting that Purdue was the only team to stay in the top five from start to finish. Like I said, knowing who’s going to be the cream of the crop cannot be predicted perfectly.
